intro: Limnophila elongata, commonly known as the slender water nettle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Limnophylaceae. It is an aquatic or semi-aquatic plant that typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds and marshes. The plant has slender, branching stems that are often covered in fine, hair-like structures. Its small, greenish-white flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom during the summer months. Limnophila elongata plays a role in providing habitat and food for various aquatic invertebrates and amphibians.
